content.description:
Sit start from small hueco on the bottom right side of the east face; it's right next to the corner. Work left and up staying on lower slopers, ledges, and crimps. Pull up and top out over the nose in the same spot as

Cashin' Checks

.
content.protection:
Like

Cashin' Checks

, a fall puts you into the pit, so 4 pads is recommended, although 3 will be alright. A spotter is useful as well.
content.location: This is on the East face of the U.S.S. Boulder. Downclimb on the southeast corner of the boulder.

content.description:
Shellback Initiation is short and simple. It's a one move wonder. Reach and height will likely affect your experience on this one.

Sit start with a left hand on the nose's arete and a right hand crimp on the face. From there, gain a great right foot edge, slap the left hand up the arete, then make a big move to a right hand sloper below the lip, then match at the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pad or two. It has a good landing, but there is a rock behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the west side of the northwest arete.

content.description: Sit start with matched hands on small ledge, make one big move straight up to a solid ledge. The topout is dirty, so be careful.
content.protection: A couple of pads and a spotter on this one.
content.location: This is on the East face of the boulder, on the left part of the overhang.

content.description: Sit start from the hueco, then move to a pair of slopers and a crimp that access an easy topout.
content.protection: Pad, there are a few large rocks at the base of the problem.
content.location: This is on the east-facing side of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit start with same hands as

Mountain Ants Taste Like Lemonade

, and start moving right on low ledge. Make a big move up and to the right, top out over the nose of the wall.
content.protection: We made it by with only 3 pads, but 4 is suggested. A fall from the top drops you perfectly into a pit surrounded by some large rocks, so set your pads up carefully. A spotter should do the trick.
content.location: Start on the lower left side of the East face of the U.S.S. Boulder. Move right and up.
